title: Signal Processing Block
description:
GEN_SIN is a sine wave generator with programmable period, adjustable
amplitude and signal ofset. A special feature is a adjustable delay so that
with multiple generators overlapping signals can be generated. A Binary
Output Q passes a logical signal, which is generated phase equal to the
sine signal. The input DL is a delay for the output signal. The Delay is speï¿¾cifed with DL * PT. A DL of 0.5 delays the signal by half a period. 
The following example shows GEN_SIN with a trace recording of the sine
signal and the binary output Q.
The above example generates a sine wave with 0.1 Hz (PT = 10 s) and a
lower peak value of 0 and upper peak value of 10.
name: SIGNAL_4

input.name: IN1
input.description: Boolean input representing the first signal.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Boolean input representing the second signal.

input.name: IN3
input.description: Boolean input representing the third signal.

input.name: IN4
input.description: Boolean input representing the fourth signal.

input.name: TS
input.description: Timestamp indicating the time at which the signals are processed.

input.name: S1
input.description: Byte pattern for the first signal, initialized to 16#FF.

input.name: S2
input.description: Byte pattern for the second signal, initialized to 16#F0.

input.name: S3
input.description: Byte pattern for the third signal, initialized to 16#AA.

input.name: S4
input.description: Byte pattern for the fourth signal, initialized to 16#A0.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output boolean indicating whether an alarm condition is present.
